Description of change
Added a spinner for the Search page. When the page is retrieving search settings or doing a search, show the spinner before those actions are completed. Where the spinner is positioned is dependent on if the search result list is empty or not.

commit.message:
Add a spinner for Search page

Show a spinner when a search is in progress. The position of the spinner
is determined by if the search result list is empty or not.

nodes.bodyText:
This ternary has gone too far. Feels like it should now be if/else, or maybe...
{ (searchResults.length < 1 && !showSpinner)
  ? (<ListItem ...> ... </ListItem>)
  : searchResults }

Since handleError's signature is also a single param with error, this can likely be folded.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  .catch((error: Error) => handleError(error))
          
          
            
                  .catch(handleError)

commit.message:
Update Search page Jest test

1. Rather than mocking 'rest-api-client', mock SearchModule and
SearchSettingsModule as Search page interacts with these two modules.

2. After mounting the component, wait for Search promise and Search
setting promise to make sure the initial search is completed. And therefore
when tests are executed the Search page should be in order.

3. Add a test for the Search setting API call and the default search.

4. Add a test for the spinner.

Fix a comment typo issue for Search page.

Co-authored-by: SammyIsConfused <samantha.fisher@edalex.com>
